text: Inhibition of the differentiation of human myeloid cell lines by redox changes induced through glutathione depletion .
We have investigated the effect of redox changes in vivo on the differentiation of two human myeloid cell lines , HL-60 and KG-1 .

The glutathione-depleting agent diethyl maleate ( DEM ) prevented the development of differentiated features in response to phorbol esters , including adherence of the cells to plastic surfaces and repression of the <extra_id_0> myeloperoxidase <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and <extra_id_0> CD34 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> genes .

Moreover , DEM abolished phorbol 12-myristate 13-acetate - induced activation of the transcription factors AP-1 and <extra_id_0> Egr-1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , suggesting that inhibition of differentiation may be due , at least in part , to redox modifications of these proteins .
